annotation.TEXT: Ow, my gut!
FAIL!
Alright, 1-up combo time! Also, I'll cape-thwack some things while I'm at it.
I wonder what I'm supposed to do with this shell, and why are these NO blocks here?
Ah, and the level itself has been changed too. It's now a more proper level instead of mostly plain plains. waffledoctor87 made a video of this level already. (Click here to see it.)
6-life combo!
waffledoctor87, if you did make any changes to this area that I didn't see because I flew over them, let me know.
Maybe I can just get through these turn blocks by chucking Yoshi at them...
I've decided not to go to ludicrous speed for this revisit, because... reasons.
Okay, good. I'm in the pipe with two capes. I guess I'll play out this bonus room.
Whee! Yeah, I intentionally avoided using the left+right glitch while navigating through there. It would've only gotten me killed, anyway. Now to race back with this key...
I like how you can use the cape to guarantee success in these rooms.
Now, even though I'm easily able to go over the top with the already revealed blocks, I wonder if I was meant to do this with the springboard to reveal all of the blocks...
Pop goes the Hammer Brother.

Alright, that's all for that revisit. Now, as I said, I didn't see any other changes in the YI levels (so, unfortunately, those fake floor tiles at the beginning of YI3 are still there). However, there is one non-YI level that I played last time that has undergone some changes!
Okay, so first I need to make my way to a gate that'll let me go behind the fence...
I'm not jumping down there for those coins, that's for sure. (I bet I hit a P-switch later.)
Bye, Yoshi!
Yep, you can actually punch the wizard's magic from behind the fence! I never actually knew this before, so that's certainly interesting.
Hey there, Cutoff Wizard. How's it going?
This message is unchanged.
Nice, I successfully performed that glitch this time!
Or, maybe I was meant to ride the springboard under the yellow pipe like this? But, I'm easily able to cross up top, so doing this isn't really necessary.
Oh, that's neat. Those red super koopas are in the formation of a glider from Conway's Game of Life! Did you do that on purpose, waffledoctor87?
Now, I'm not playing this level blind, since I watched the entirety of waffledoctor87's video of this level, but I'll try to pretend I'm playing blind. (Gotta check every pipe...)

Okay, what happened here is kind of tricky to explain, but basically, I was actually too close to the block. You want to be at least a few pixels away from the block when you're cape-spinning it. If you're rubbing up against it, there's a chance you'll fail, like in this case.

I notice an increase in the yellow super koopa population as well, and I see that the NO blocks are getting some more use here. Now hopefully, we'll see them used for more than just holding up Lava Lotuses later on...
Yeah, that Sumo Bro. lightning fire is new. Also, there's now a Yoshi coin here! This makes up for the removal of the fifth Yoshi coin in the main area.
WAH!!!
Whoops!
Alright, those weeds have been whacked.
But, let's see if I can get all of the coins in this middle row in one fell swoop...

...What? The quake didn't kill those Lava Lotuses up there? ...Right... An enemy sprite on a NO block (or tile 1EB or 1F0) is not actually on the ground, and is instead "floating", as far as the game is concerned.
Alright, now let's remount Yoshi and move on.
Bah, screwed up. Oh, well.
Wow, even with the slowdown, I'm surprised I managed to maintain the combo there!
Hi, Yoshi!
And I still managed to run into it like an idiot after successfully dodging its initial attack.

Quick, grab the P-balloon! Now, if this is anything like Super Marina World, the silver munchers are instant death. Also, I'm pretty sure touching the gray bullet cannon bases that the munchers are on is not good for my health either.
No changes made to this screen, so let's just finish the level now.
Can I stop taking dumb hits for just a moment, please?
There's the last Yoshi coin, and another fireball-spewing piranha plant. Now, which exit should I trigger first?
BARF!
Yeah, there we go. Now for the Yoshi coin up here...

Alright, that's primarily what I wanted to show there. I'm not going to reshow the part later on that had the screwed-up sound, because all of the relevant stuff I did over there was still shown at the proper speed, and the sound wasn't important.
Goal tape average so far: 180 / 5 = 36 stars each.
C-C-C-C-COMBO BREAKER!!! (Now that I think about it, I should've put in that sound clip there. Maybe next time.) Well, I thwacked him, but couldn't maintain the combo.

Oh, there's a shell-less yellow koopa up there. Wouldn't it have been better if the yellow shell was up there instead of down here, so I would've had to dodge a disco shell that would've come at me from above?
Well... Bye, Yoshi! Sacrificial horse count: 3
Wow, I wasn't expecting a Sumo Bro. to come down like that! He just barely missed me! Hmm... I wonder if I can cape-thwack him without breaking the combo...
Hi, Yoshi! Whoa. Hidden coin block. Yeah, I actually knew that was there from watching waffledoctor87's video, and there's a second one up and to the right of it.
Okay, I'm getting sick of the super koopa generator, so I'm going to enter the next pipe to make it go away.
Alright, that should be good enough. (I probably didn't really have to show the return to midpoint, but whatever.)
WAH!!!
Now, next on the agenda, waffledoctor87 pointed out something I can do to the wizard's magic, which I'll show off now.
...What the?!
I quickly skimmed over all of the Yoshi's Island levels again off screen, and didn't see any changes to any of them, except in YI4, so let's revisit YI4!
That super koopa is new, and so are these NO blocks and the Lava Lotus.
Well, at least I managed to not lose my cape during that fiasco!
Aha! A hidden 1-up should pop out!
Quadruple gulp!
I love cape spinning explosions like that.
That was interesting how the whole Pokey ended up on Yoshi's tongue briefly as he ate the feather there.
Hi, Yoshi!
Yep, now we've got these super koopers flying all over the place.
Nah, I'm not gonna wait for Yoshi to fall in the pit again. I've already tortured him more than enough for one day.
Okay, now it's obvious how this is meant to work.
And now, ludicrous speed bonus game! (And I double-checked this one to make sure WMM didn't screw it up!)
Quadruple gulp!
waffledoctor87, you may want to put reset doors here just in case the player misses the P-balloon, or somehow doesn't get all the way through this part in time.
Hmm... I guess I gotta feed Yoshi these Goombas...
Alright, I think I'll get the secret exit first, and then hit the normal goal second.
Quintuple gulp!
"Tick." Graze +1.
Sacrificial horse count: 5
And that's it for the backtracking, so let's check out this level's other bonus room.
Well, so much for those glider koopas.
Nice, another perfect! Oh, and since I have a reserve cape that I can switch to, I've totally gotta do at least one victory dive bomb! (Remember, it's required by law if I'm able to do so!)
Oh, man. Hidden blocks. Is this a bridge-building segment? Yeah, it's a bridge-building segment.
Oh, man. That fireball-spitting piranha plant tried to ambush me from that bush.
Quintuple gulp! Yes!
Alright, here's what I want to show you...
Sacrificial horse count: 2
Bonus game average so far: 16 / 2 = 8 1-ups each.
WAH!!!
Wow, that sucked. Way to lose both of my flowers just like that. Oh, well.

Aha! There's the one change that I noticed in this main area! The log below the pipe is now the proper length, so the screen stops scrolling in the right spot, removing the cutoff issue that was there last time!
Now, as I was saying, the level begins the same way, and in fact, the main area is almost exactly the same. However, in the side area...
Alright, now to get my capes back.
Goal tape average so far: 220 / 6 = 36.667 stars each.
I'll just show myself returning to the midpoint area here, and then I'll cut to where I ended the last episode at (before I showed the ludicrous speed bonus game clip).
I'm carefully redirecting the magic because I can't rely on a coin forming over my head every time! (I think that's an 8/256 or 1/32 chance, right?)

Huh. That opened up a path leading to Top Banana Zone. (I thought about putting the relevant DK64 sound clip here, but I'll wait until I actually play the level.) Also, the game will let me go south from there to Donut House 1.
Alright, I've now collected five Yoshi coins in this level, thanks to the one added to the side area!

So, stand almost half a block away from these blocks and try to just barely tap the lower-left corner of them with your cape. (However, if you're not going from left to right, don't stand so far away that you accidentally hit the block to your left by mistake.)
Hi, Yoshi!
Hello, and welcome back to Super Tweak World! Last time, WMM screwed up some of my Disappearing Tides footage. Here's that footage, properly shown this time.
Alright, back to this mostly unchanged area. There is one change to this area that I noticed which I will point out when I get to it.
15-life combo!
Now, the beginning of the level is the same as before... Oh, hold on. I want to try something here...
Hmm... I'm guessing this room isn't changed, so I'm just going to fly from one end to the other and not bother getting all of the coins.
Meh. I'll just Yoshi run around down there for the moment while I do other things.
Zwee! Yeah, I'm backtracking here to show the stuff that the bonus room pipe sent me past, like usual.

Yep, the Morton's Plains level, which has had a name change. It's now called "NO Block Randomness", with something odd about the "NO" letters... It's like the background water is trying to show through them.
Now, remember how I showed off the updated version of this hack last episode, and how there weren't actually very many changes, and a seemingly-incomplete Morton's Plains level?
...Wait, I meant "Iggy", and the fight wasn't "Iffy" at all, I don't think. Well, anyway, it's finally time for me to play Donut Plains 1! Let's see what tweaks have been made to this level...
Looks like I just turned that glider into a J-block Tetromino/Tetrimino. (Why do official Tetris games nowadays use "Tetrimino", when "Tetromino" is the normal name for such a shape?)
Oh, that's weird. While I'm climbing on the fence, my cape turns invisible when the wizard's magic is present.
To be continued... Yo!
POP!
Sacrificial horse count: 4
No change to that message. Now to use the turbo A button to get 32 coins from this multi-coin block!
Alright, this level is done like a turkey dinner, which I probably should've eaten 12 days ago.
Nope. Didn't pull it off. Oh, well. Hi, Yoshi!

Well, it turns out the 87th pizzelle physician initially sent me the wrong file, which wasn't the proper updated version. Now, after I played DP1 here, I switched over to the correct version (which didn't appear to change anything in DP1, so I don't have to redo that level).
Now, I obviously don't want to try standing on those NO blocks myself. However, I could place the springboard on them.
Umm... That's true, but not very helpful to me if he's not grown up. Maybe you should put a reset door here in case someone screws up the feeding process, like I just did.
I guess I'll try to stick to the sky on this trip. (..."Stick to the sky"? How would I do that? With glue or duct tape or something like that?)
Much better. Now for that normal exit...
Okay, so last time, I had just defeated Iffy!
So, over there at midpoint, if you jump on the middle arch, followed by the right arch, then the left arch, and then jump on the floating yellow pipe a few screens to the left...

(Oh, and don't worry about this playthrough eventually becoming like Super Marina World, where I could potentially have 20-something unplayed levels available at once! I'm sure the choice of 4 here will be the most this hack will have to offer.)
So, that means there are now four levels available to me: Top Banana Zone, Donut House 1, Donut Plains 2, and Donut Secret 1! Which one should I play next? Cast your votes now!
Oh, nuts. I wanted to do a second dive bomb, but I collected the last 1-up too soon. Oh, well. At least I got off one dive bomb.
I decided to get the star right away, before the flying cheepos had a chance to use Knock Off on Yoshi, which would deal 1.5x the usual damage for knocking me off.
Um, whoops. I didn't mean to fry the guy that can give me a cape feather, but if I just avoid collecting the resulting coin, I can make him respawn and try for the cape again!
Same tutorial message as before. Oh, and that bomb's gonna blow in a few seconds... Also, to be more fair to this level, I'm throwing Yoshi away now. Bye, Yoshi!

Well, right away, I see some vampiric ? blocks, and a Chuck that I assume can summon super koopas. Now, I could just fry the guy to prevent the summoning, but I'll be a sporting guy and let him summon the super duders.
Now, after using the key to get through the turn blocks, just bring it over to the keyhole to finish the level, obviously.
Come on... Oh, wait. I think I have to circle around the other way.
12-life combo!
Huh, I'm pretty sure that Pokey is a new addition to this level. Oh, let's see if I can do the glitch involving me getting hit while cape spinning this Yoshi block...
